diff_hunk:
@@ -142,8 +143,15 @@ def gradcheck(func, inputs, eps=1e-6, atol=1e-5, rtol=1e-3, raise_exception=True
 
     .. note::
         The default values are designed for :attr:`input` of double precision.
-        This check will likely fail if :attr:`input` is of single precision,
-        i.e., ``FloatTensor``.
+        This check will likely fail if :attr:`input` is of less precision, e.g.,
+        ``FloatTensor``.
+
+    .. warning::
body: Adds some warnings about using `gradcheck` when checked tensors have overlapping memory because numerical Jacobian from point perturbation will fail.
body_html: Adds some warnings about using gradcheck when checked tensors have overlapping memory because numerical Jacobian from point perturbation will fail.
body_text: Adds some warnings about using gradcheck when checked tensors have overlapping memory because numerical Jacobian from point perturbation will fail.
